Distress.definition: seizure and detention of the goods of another as pledge or to obtain satisfaction of a claim by the sale of the goods seized ;specif
Distress.origin: [Anglo-French destrece , literally, tightness, anguish, deprivation, from Old French, ultimately from Late Latin districtus severe, from past participle of distringere to hinder, punish see distrain ]

1.definition: seizure and detention of the goods of another as pledge or to obtain satisfaction of a claim by the sale of the goods seizedseizure by a landlord of a tenant's property to obtain satisfaction of arrearages in rent
1.note: Distress is regulated by statute where available. It has been held unconstitutional by some courts.

2.definition: pain or suffering affecting the body, a bodily part, or the mind see also
